result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian C. Carley

defendant.name: Carley, Brian C.
defendant.address: 561 Pleasant View Ct., Richland Center, WI 53581

records.addlTxt: Status conference on January 19, 2023 at 02:00 pm.

1:23 PM 2021CM000176/22CM52/ 22CF80 - Defendant Brian C. Carley in court.  Attorney Andrew J. Burdick appeared by video for Brian C. Carley.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Burdick speaks that BC would like to enter a NG plea and a NGI.

22CM52 - Max penalties stated. Attorney Burdick enters a NGI plea.
22CF80 - Max penalties stated. Attorney Burdick enters a NGI plea.

Court appoint Dr. Scott Woodley and deadline for the report is 1/16/23.
Status conference scheduled for January 19, 2023 at 02:00 pm.

2:08 PM 21CM176/ 22CF52/ 22CF80 - Defendant Brian C. Carley in court.  Attorney Andrew J. Burdick in court for Brian C. Carley.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Burdick provides the court with a waiver of the preliminary hearing form for 22CF52 and 22CF80. Court goes over the waiver of the preliminary hearing form. Court binds over for trial. Attorney Burdick asks for a date and time for the arraignment. 

Attorney Burdick states that we are not objecting the competency report.

02:32 PM - Same appearances. Court speaks about the competency report. BC states that he is competent. Court finds the defendant competent to proceed. Attorney Burdick still feel satisfied with the waiver of the preliminary hearing. Court confirms the bind over for trial.
Arraignment scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on September 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on September 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
3:07 PM Defendant Brian C. Carley in court, in custody.  Attorney Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Eisenberg appears for this hearing only. Attorney Eisenberg waives the formal reading. Max penalties stated. Attorney Eisenberg speaks about competency examination. Court will orders a competency exam. Court sets status instead of competency hearing due to Judge McDougal having to recuse from this case.
Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Harper appears for the state. Brian Carley appears by zoom from the Vernon County Jail. 

Attorney Harper speaks about BC and asks for a $7,500 cash bond with the conditions:
No contact with any Dairy Queen.
No contact with any public park.
Not to be on the premise of any school. 
No contact with public schools.
No contact with females under the age of 18 in person or by any computerized technology. 
Take medication as prescribed.

So ordered.

Initial set for 07/05/22 at 3 PM
